com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Map

Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Map.AbstractPosition
      • com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Map.Coordinate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Coordinate
extends AbstractPosition
    A coordinate is a reference to a specific cell in the map. The coordinate can transcode between relative and absolute coordinates.
    Relative coordinates are similar to the map array. Absolute coordinates are indipendent of the current map but to access them you must have the chunk where the coordiantes are pointing to in memory.
    The coordinate uses a continously height value. The Z coordinate value can be calculated.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getNeighbourSide

        public static int getNeighbourSide(float x,
                                   float y)
        Returns the field-id where the coordiantes are inside in relation to the current field. Field id count clockwise, starting with the top with 0. If you want to get the neighbour you can use goToNeighbour(int) with the parameter found by this function. The numbering of the sides:
        7 \ 0 / 1
        -------
        6 | 8 | 2
        -------
        5 / 4 \ 3
        Run time: O(1)
        Parameters:
        x - game-space-coordinates, value in pixels
        y - game-space-coordinates, value in pixels
        Returns:
        Returns the fieldnumber of the coordinates. 8 is the field itself.
        See Also:
        goToNeighbour(int)

      • goToNeighbour

        public Coordinate goToNeighbour(int neighbourSide)
        Goes to the the neighbour with the specific side.
        7 \ 0 / 1
        -------
        6 | 8 | 2
        -------
        5 / 4 \ 3
        O(const)
        Parameters:
        neighbourSide - the side number of the given coordinates
        Returns:
        itself for chaining

        public int getViewSpcX(GameView view)
        Description copied from class: AbstractPosition
        Calculate position in view space.
        Specified by:
        getViewSpcX in class AbstractPosition
        Returns:
        Returns the center of the projected (screen) x-position where the object is rendered without regarding the camera. It also adds the cell offset.
